© 2020 New Mexico State University - Board of Regents
Ready to apply to NMSU? The process is quick and convenient with our online application.
The application will require you to provide the following:
Semester when you plan to start
Campus where you plan to enroll
New Mexico Residency for In-State Tuition Purposes
Contact information for at least one parent, guardian, or spouse (if applicable)
Log in to the undergraduate application
using the email and password you previously set up, or
create a new undergraduate application account
You can save your application at any time and return to it later. You can also revise your application before submitting it.
Allow approximately 45 minutes to complete your application.
The application fee is $25 and nonrefundable.
Pay online with a credit card after you finalize and submit your application for admission.
Pay by check. Make your check payable to New Mexico State University, and include the applicant’s full name and date of birth in the memo line. Mail your check to:
Have your official ACT or SAT test scores sent to NMSU:
Have your high school counselor or registrar send your most recent official transcript to:
After you have graduated from high school
Have your final official transcript sent to:
Contact Undergraduate Admissions at 575-646-3121 or 800-662-6678 if you have questions or need assistance with the application process.
applying as undergraduates should start here, but additional assistance is available through NMSU's
Defense Activity for Non-Traditional Educational Support Credit (DANTES)
Notice of Non-discrimination and Equal Opportunity
© 2016 New Mexico State University - Board of Regents
Aggie Experience is more than an ordinary college open house, it’s a specially tailored day of discovery!
Experience NMSU for yourself. Our campus visits are designed around your specific academic interests.
Take a Virtual Tour of NMSU
With our virtual tour, you can enjoy 360° panoramic views of NMSU from your computer or mobile device.

At New Mexico State University we are all about discovery! In the classroom, in the lab and out in the field – we provide you with invaluable opportunities to find out who you are and what you want to be. The Undergraduate Admissions office is here to help you begin your journey as an Aggie.

Here at NMSU you will gain experience and know-how that will prepare you to lead the next generation of scientists, engineers, business and health care professionals, scholars and teachers. You will learn from and work alongside top-notch faculty and researchers at the helm of our 21st-century fields of study.
Learn more about all that New Mexico State University has to offer, including our academic programs, admission requirements, scholarships, and more.
Stay informed with messages from us, invitations to events, and reminders about admissions, financial aid, and scholarship deadlines.
Experience for yourself why NMSU is a special place.
With our self-guided virtual tour, you can enjoy 360° panoramic views of NMSU from your computer or mobile device.

We Define the Course of Our Success

We are New Mexico’s land-grant institution and a comprehensive research university dedicated to teaching, research and service at all levels. Recognized as a top-tier university by U.S. News & World Report, NMSU is a welcoming community of talented faculty, staff and students who are working together to make a difference.
As a NASA Space Grant College, a Hispanic-serving institution and home to the first Honors College in New Mexico, NMSU offers an accessible education that shapes bright futures.
Find excellence in any of our degree options. Bachelor's and associates degrees are offered in a number of majors and pre-professional programs.
Advance your personal and professional goals at NMSU. Masterâs and doctoral degrees are available through many traditional or distance based programs.

We understand the key role that family members play in studentsâ lives and their academic success. Our Aggie Welcome and Family Outreach Office is a support system empowering parents and families with valuable resources.
Pursue your passion in a welcoming, diverse campus community. Outstanding undergraduate and graduate degree programs are available.
Learn about our flexible degree options that fit your schedule. We offer associate, bachelorâs, masterâs and doctoral degrees through different distance education delivery methods.
Apache Point ranked No. 2 among U.S. college observatories
Apache Point Observatory, operated by NMSU and owned by the ARC, is ranked 2nd by Collegerank.net among the top 35 college observatories in the country for 2019.
NMSU among U.S. News & World Report Best Global Universities 2020
NMSU was recognized on the sixth annual U.S. News & World Report Best Global Universities 2020 rankings. NMSU is among 1,500 institutions in 81 countries listed, and this year NMSU tied for 710th.
